bestBHT.bht: After the Lord has exhausted all His judgments, the great day of the Lord comes when all ordinary judgments shall have been exhausted by the Lord. Before inflicting His blow, the elect must be gathered, the day, the great (day), has come, and no one can stand against the wrath of God and the Lamb. This cry of terror is answered by the command to keep awake and pray, seeking strength to stand before the Son of Man. The great day of His wrath answers the cry of the martyrs.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: After the Lord has exhausted all His ordinary judgments, the great day of the Lord itself shall come."
The sixth seal brings us to the verge of the Lord's coming.
But before He actually inflicts the blow in person, 'the elect' must be 'gathered' out.
Marvin Vincent: The great day [η ημερα η μεγαλη]. Lit., the day, the great (day).
Shall be able to stand [δυναται σταθηναι]. Rev., rightly, is able.
Archibald T. Robertson: Their" (αυτων) means the wrath of God and of the Lamb put here on an equality as in Revelation 1:17; Revelation 22:3; Revelation 22:13; 1 Thessalonians 3:11; 2 Thessalonians 2:16.
Beckwith holds that this language about the great day having come "is the mistaken cry of men in terror caused by the portents which are bursting upon them.

Swete observes that the only possible answer to that cry is the command of Jesus in Luke 21:36: "Keep awake on every occasion, praying that ye may get strength to stand (σταθηνα, the very form) before the Son of Man.
John Gill: For the great day of his wrath is come... against the Heathen gods and Heathen persecutors, in answer to the cry of the martyrs
And who shall be able to stand? against either of them, or in their presence... expresses guilt, shame, fear, and despair.

bhtAttempts.bht: After the Lord has exhausted all His ordinary judgments, the great day of the Lord itself shall come, bringing us to the verge of His coming. But before He inflicts the blow in person, the elect must be gathered out. The great day, the day, the great day, has come, and no one shall be able to stand against the wrath of God and of the Lamb. This cry of men in terror is met with the command to keep awake and pray, seeking strength to stand before the Son of Man. The great day of His wrath has come to answer the cry of the martyrs, and the question of who shall be able to stand expresses guilt, shame, fear, and despair.

After the Lord has exhausted all His judgments, the great day of the Lord shall come, bringing us to the verge of His coming. But before He inflicts the blow, the elect must be gathered out. The great day, the day, the great day, has come, and no one shall be able to stand against the wrath of God and of the Lamb. This cry of terror is met with the command to keep awake and pray, seeking strength to stand before the Son of Man. The great day of His wrath has come to answer the cry of the martyrs.

After the Lord has exhausted His judgments, the great day of the Lord shall come. Before He inflicts the blow, the elect must be gathered out. The great day, the day, the great day, has come, and no one shall be able to stand against the wrath of God and of the Lamb. This cry of terror is met with the command to keep awake and pray, seeking strength to stand before the Son of Man. The great day of His wrath has come to answer the cry of the martyrs.

When all of the Lord's ordinary judgments have been exhausted, the great day of the Lord itself shall come, bringing us to the brink of His coming. However, before the blow is delivered in person, the elect must be gathered out. The great day, the day, the great day, has come, and no one shall be able to stand against the wrath of God and of the Lamb. In response to the cry of men in terror, the command is given to keep awake and pray, seeking strength to stand before the Son of Man. The great day of His wrath has arrived, answering the plea of the martyrs.

After the Lord has exhausted all His judgments, the great day of the Lord comes when all ordinary judgments shall have been exhausted by the Lord. Before inflicting His blow, the elect must be gathered, the day, the great (day), has come, and no one can stand against the wrath of God and the Lamb. This cry of terror is answered by the command to keep awake and pray, seeking strength to stand before the Son of Man. The great day of His wrath answers the cry of the martyrs.
